Events.BriefDescription: Write request of 4 bytes made by IIO Part0 to Memory
Events.PublicDescription: Data requested of the CPU : Card writing to DRAM : Number of DWs (4 bytes) the card requests of the main die.    Includes all requests initiated by the Card, including reads and writes. : x16 card plugged in to stack, Or x8 card plugged in to Lane 0/1, Or x4 card is plugged in to slot 0

Events.BriefDescription: IMC Clockticks at DCLK frequency
Events.PublicDescription: Number of DRAM DCLK clock cycles while the event is enabled

Events.BriefDescription: IMC Clockticks at HCLK frequency
Events.PublicDescription: Number of DRAM HCLK clock cycles while the event is enabled

Events.BriefDescription: All DRAM read CAS commands issued (does not include underfills)
Events.PublicDescription: DRAM RD_CAS and WR_CAS Commands. : DRAM RD_CAS commands w/out auto-pre : DRAM RD_CAS and WR_CAS Commands : Counts the total number or DRAM Read CAS commands issued on this channel.  This includes both regular RD CAS commands as well as those with implicit Precharge.   We do not filter based on major mode, as RD_CAS is not issued during WMM (with the exception of underfills).

Events.BriefDescription: DRAM underfill read CAS commands issued
Events.PublicDescription: DRAM RD_CAS and WR_CAS Commands. : Underfill Read Issued : DRAM RD_CAS and WR_CAS Commands

Events.BriefDescription: All DRAM read CAS commands issued (including underfills)
Events.PublicDescription: DRAM RD_CAS and WR_CAS Commands : Counts the total number of DRAM Read CAS commands issued on this channel.  This includes underfills.

Events.BriefDescription: All DRAM write CAS commands issued
Events.PublicDescription: DRAM RD_CAS and WR_CAS Commands : Counts the total number of DRAM Write CAS commands issued on this channel.

Events.BriefDescription: Read Pending Queue Allocations
Events.PublicDescription: Read Pending Queue Allocations : Counts the number of allocations into the Read Pending Queue.  This queue is used to schedule reads out to the memory controller and to track the requests.  Requests allocate into the RPQ soon after they enter the memory controller, and need credits for an entry in this buffer before being sent from the HA to the iMC.  They deallocate after the CAS command has been issued to memory.  This includes both ISOCH and non-ISOCH requests.

Events.BriefDescription: Read Pending Queue Allocations
Events.PublicDescription: Read Pending Queue Allocations : Counts the number of allocations into the Read Pending Queue.  This queue is used to schedule reads out to the memory controller and to track the requests.  Requests allocate into the RPQ soon after they enter the memory controller, and need credits for an entry in this buffer before being sent from the HA to the iMC.  They deallocate after the CAS command has been issued to memory.  This includes both ISOCH and non-ISOCH requests.

Events.BriefDescription: Write Pending Queue Allocations
Events.PublicDescription: Write Pending Queue Allocations : Counts the number of allocations into the Write Pending Queue.  This can then be used to calculate the average queuing latency (in conjunction with the WPQ occupancy count).  The WPQ is used to schedule write out to the memory controller and to track the writes.  Requests allocate into the WPQ soon after they enter the memory controller, and need credits for an entry in this buffer before being sent from the CHA to the iMC.  They deallocate after being issued to DRAM.  Write requests themselves are able to complete (from the perspective of the rest of the system) as soon they have posted to the iMC.

Events.BriefDescription: Write Pending Queue Allocations
Events.PublicDescription: Write Pending Queue Allocations : Counts the number of allocations into the Write Pending Queue.  This can then be used to calculate the average queuing latency (in conjunction with the WPQ occupancy count).  The WPQ is used to schedule write out to the memory controller and to track the writes.  Requests allocate into the WPQ soon after they enter the memory controller, and need credits for an entry in this buffer before being sent from the CHA to the iMC.  They deallocate after being issued to DRAM.  Write requests themselves are able to complete (from the perspective of the rest of the system) as soon they have posted to the iMC.

Events.BriefDescription: Read Pending Queue Occupancy
Events.PublicDescription: Read Pending Queue Occupancy : Accumulates the occupancies of the Read Pending Queue each cycle.  This can then be used to calculate both the average occupancy (in conjunction with the number of cycles not empty) and the average latency (in conjunction with the number of allocations).  The RPQ is used to schedule reads out to the memory controller and to track the requests.  Requests allocate into the RPQ soon after they enter the memory controller, and need credits for an entry in this buffer before being sent from the HA to the iMC. They deallocate after the CAS command has been issued to memory.

Events.BriefDescription: Read Pending Queue Occupancy
Events.PublicDescription: Read Pending Queue Occupancy : Accumulates the occupancies of the Read Pending Queue each cycle.  This can then be used to calculate both the average occupancy (in conjunction with the number of cycles not empty) and the average latency (in conjunction with the number of allocations).  The RPQ is used to schedule reads out to the memory controller and to track the requests.  Requests allocate into the RPQ soon after they enter the memory controller, and need credits for an entry in this buffer before being sent from the HA to the iMC. They deallocate after the CAS command has been issued to memory.

Events.BriefDescription: Write Pending Queue Occupancy
Events.PublicDescription: Write Pending Queue Occupancy : Accumulates the occupancies of the Write Pending Queue each cycle.  This can then be used to calculate both the average queue occupancy (in conjunction with the number of cycles not empty) and the average latency (in conjunction with the number of allocations).  The WPQ is used to schedule write out to the memory controller and to track the writes.  Requests allocate into the WPQ soon after they enter the memory controller, and need credits for an entry in this buffer before being sent from the HA to the iMC.  They deallocate after being issued to DRAM.  Write requests themselves are able to complete (from the perspective of the rest of the system) as soon they have posted to the iMC.  This is not to be confused with actually performing the write to DRAM.  Therefore, the average latency for this queue is actually not useful for deconstruction intermediate write latencies.  So, we provide filtering based on if the request has posted or not.  By using the not posted filter, we can track how long writes spent in the iMC before completions were sent to the HA.  The posted filter, on the other hand, provides information about how much queueing is actually happening in the iMC for writes before they are actually issued to memory.  High average occupancies will generally coincide with high write major mode counts.

Events.BriefDescription: Write Pending Queue Occupancy
Events.PublicDescription: Write Pending Queue Occupancy : Accumulates the occupancies of the Write Pending Queue each cycle.  This can then be used to calculate both the average queue occupancy (in conjunction with the number of cycles not empty) and the average latency (in conjunction with the number of allocations).  The WPQ is used to schedule write out to the memory controller and to track the writes.  Requests allocate into the WPQ soon after they enter the memory controller, and need credits for an entry in this buffer before being sent from the HA to the iMC.  They deallocate after being issued to DRAM.  Write requests themselves are able to complete (from the perspective of the rest of the system) as soon they have posted to the iMC.  This is not to be confused with actually performing the write to DRAM.  Therefore, the average latency for this queue is actually not useful for deconstruction intermediate write latencies.  So, we provide filtering based on if the request has posted or not.  By using the not posted filter, we can track how long writes spent in the iMC before completions were sent to the HA.  The posted filter, on the other hand, provides information about how much queueing is actually happening in the iMC for writes before they are actually issued to memory.  High average occupancies will generally coincide with high write major mode counts.

Events.BriefDescription: M2M Clockticks
Events.PublicDescription: Clockticks of the mesh to memory (M2M)

Events.BriefDescription: Multi-socket cacheline Directory update from/to Any state
Events.PublicDescription: Multi-socket cacheline Directory update from/to Any state

Events.BriefDescription: M3UPI Clockticks
Events.PublicDescription: Number of M2UPI clock cycles while the event is enabled

Events.BriefDescription: UPI Clockticks
Events.PublicDescription: Number of UPI LL clock cycles while the event is enabled

Events.BriefDescription: Valid Flits Sent : All Data
Events.PublicDescription: Valid Flits Sent : All Data : Counts number of data flits across this UPI link.

Events.BriefDescription: Read requests from a unit on this socket
Events.PublicDescription: Counts read requests coming from a unit on this socket made into this CHA. Reads include all read opcodes (including RFO: the Read for Ownership issued before a  write).

Events.BriefDescription: Read requests from a remote socket
Events.PublicDescription: Counts read requests coming from a remote socket made into the CHA. Reads include all read opcodes (including RFO: the Read for Ownership issued before a  write).

Events.BriefDescription: Write Requests from a unit on this socket
Events.PublicDescription: Counts  write requests coming from a unit on this socket made into this CHA, including streaming, evictions, HitM (Reads from another core to a Modified cacheline), etc.

Events.BriefDescription: Read and Write Requests; Writes Remote
Events.PublicDescription: Counts the total number of read requests made into the Home Agent. Reads include all read opcodes (including RFO).  Writes include all writes (streaming, evictions, HitM, etc).

Events.BriefDescription: Requests for exclusive ownership of a cache line without receiving data
Events.PublicDescription: Counts the total number of requests coming from a unit on this socket for exclusive ownership of a cache line without receiving data (INVITOE) to the CHA.

Events.BriefDescription: Multi-socket cacheline Directory state updates; Directory Updated memory write from the HA pipe
Events.PublicDescription: Counts only multi-socket cacheline Directory state updates memory writes issued from the HA pipe. This does not include memory write requests which are for I (Invalid) or E (Exclusive) cachelines.

Events.BriefDescription: Multi-socket cacheline Directory state updates; Directory Updated memory write from TOR pipe
Events.PublicDescription: Counts only multi-socket cacheline Directory state updates due to memory writes issued from the TOR pipe which are the result of remote transaction hitting the SF/LLC and returning data Core2Core. This does not include memory write requests which are for I (Invalid) or E (Exclusive) cachelines.

Events.BriefDescription: CHA Clockticks
Events.PublicDescription: Number of CHA clock cycles while the event is enabled

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Inserts for CRd misses from local IA
Events.PublicDescription: Inserts into the TOR from local IA cores which miss the LLC and snoop filter with the opcode CRd

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Inserts for DRd misses from local IA
Events.PublicDescription: Inserts into the TOR from local IA cores which miss the LLC and snoop filter with the opcode DRd

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Inserts for DRd Pref misses from local IA
Events.PublicDescription: Inserts into the TOR from local IA cores which miss the LLC and snoop filter with the opcode DRD_PREF

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Inserts for ItoM from local IO
Events.PublicDescription: Inserts into the TOR from local IO with the opcode ItoM

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Inserts for DRd misses from local IA targeting local memory
Events.PublicDescription: Inserts into the TOR from local IA cores which miss the LLC and snoop filter with the opcode DRd, and which target local memory

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Inserts for DRd misses from local IA targeting remote memory
Events.PublicDescription: Inserts into the TOR from local IA cores which miss the LLC and snoop filter with the opcode DRd, and target remote memory

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Inserts for DRd Pref misses from local IA targeting local memory
Events.PublicDescription: Inserts into the TOR from local IA cores which miss the LLC and snoop filter with the opcode DRD_PREF, and target local memory

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Inserts for DRd Pref misses from local IA targeting remote memory
Events.PublicDescription: Inserts into the TOR from local IA cores which miss the LLC and snoop filter with the opcode DRD_PREF, and target remote memory

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Occupancy for DRd misses from local IA
Events.PublicDescription: Number of cycles for elements in the TOR from local IA cores which miss the LLC and snoop filter with the opcode DRd

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Occupancy for DRd misses from local IA targeting local memory
Events.PublicDescription: Number of cycles for elements in the TOR from local IA cores which miss the LLC and snoop filter with the opcode DRd, and which target local memory

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Occupancy for DRd misses from local IA targeting remote memory
Events.PublicDescription: Number of cycles for elements in the TOR from local IA cores which miss the LLC and snoop filter with the opcode DRd, and which target remote memory

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Inserts for DRds issued by iA Cores targeting PMM Mem that Missed the LLC
Events.PublicDescription: Inserts into the TOR from local IA cores which miss the LLC and snoop filter with the opcode DRd, and which target PMM memory

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Inserts for DRds issued by IA Cores targeting DDR Mem that Missed the LLC
Events.PublicDescription: Inserts into the TOR from local IA cores which miss the LLC and snoop filter with the opcode DRd, and which target DDR memory

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Occupancy for DRds issued by iA Cores targeting DDR Mem that Missed the LLC
Events.PublicDescription: Number of cycles for elements in the TOR from local IA cores which miss the LLC and snoop filter with the opcode DRd, and which target DDR memory

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Occupancy for DRds issued by iA Cores targeting PMM Mem that Missed the LLC
Events.PublicDescription: Number of cycles for elements in the TOR from local IA cores which miss the LLC and snoop filter with the opcode DRd, and which target PMM memory

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Inserts : DRd PTEs issued by iA Cores that Missed the LLC
Events.PublicDescription: TOR Inserts : DRd PTEs issued by iA Cores due to a page walk that missed the LLC : Counts the number of entries successfully inserted into the TOR that match qualifications specified by the subevent.   Does not include addressless requests such as locks and interrupts.

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Inserts : DRd PTEs issued by iA Cores that Hit the LLC
Events.PublicDescription: TOR Inserts : DRd PTEs issued by iA Cores due to page walks that hit the LLC : Counts the number of entries successfully inserted into the TOR that match qualifications specified by the subevent.   Does not include addressless requests such as locks and interrupts.

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Inserts : DRd PTEs issued by iA Cores
Events.PublicDescription: TOR Inserts : DRd PTEs issued by iA Cores due to a page walk : Counts the number of entries successfully inserted into the TOR that match qualifications specified by the subevent.   Does not include addressless requests such as locks and interrupts.

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Inserts for RdCur from local IO
Events.PublicDescription: Inserts into the TOR from local IO with the opcode RdCur

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Inserts; LLCPrefData hits from local IA
Events.PublicDescription: TOR Inserts; Last level cache prefetch data read from local IA that hits in the snoop filter

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Inserts; LLCPrefData from local IA
Events.PublicDescription: TOR Inserts; Last level cache prefetch data read from local IA.

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Inserts; LLCPrefData misses from local IA
Events.PublicDescription: TOR Inserts; Last level cache prefetch data read from local IA that misses in the snoop filter

Events.BriefDescription: TOR Inserts for ItoMCacheNears from IO devices.
Events.PublicDescription: Inserts into the TOR from local IO devices with the opcode ItoMCacheNears.  This event indicates a partial write request.

Events.BriefDescription: PMM Read Pending Queue occupancy
Events.PublicDescription: Accumulates the per cycle occupancy of the PMM Read Pending Queue.

Events.BriefDescription: PMM Read Pending Queue occupancy
Events.PublicDescription: Accumulates the per cycle occupancy of the PMM Read Pending Queue.

Events.BriefDescription: PMM Read Pending Queue inserts
Events.PublicDescription: Counts number of read requests allocated in the PMM Read Pending Queue.

Events.BriefDescription: PMM Write Pending Queue Occupancy
Events.PublicDescription: PMM Write Pending Queue Occupancy : Accumulates the per cycle occupancy of the Write Pending Queue to the PMM DIMM.

Events.BriefDescription: PMM Write Pending Queue inserts
Events.PublicDescription: Counts number of  write requests allocated in the PMM Write Pending Queue.

Events.BriefDescription: PMM Write Pending Queue Occupancy
Events.PublicDescription: PMM Write Pending Queue Occupancy : Accumulates the per cycle occupancy of the PMM Write Pending Queue.

Events.BriefDescription: PMM Write Pending Queue Occupancy
Events.PublicDescription: PMM Write Pending Queue Occupancy : Accumulates the per cycle occupancy of the PMM Write Pending Queue.

Events.BriefDescription: Number Transactions requested of the CPU : Card writing to another Card (same or different stack)
Events.PublicDescription: Number Transactions requested of the CPU : Card writing to another Card (same or different stack) : Also known as Inbound.  Number of 64B cache line requests initiated by the Card, including reads and writes. : x16 card plugged in to Lane 0/1/2/3, Or x8 card plugged in to Lane 0/1, Or x4 card is plugged in to slot 0

Events.PublicDescription: Number Transactions requested of the CPU : Card writing to another Card (same or different stack) : Also known as Inbound.  Number of 64B cache line requests initiated by the Card, including reads and writes. : x4 card is plugged in to slot 1

Events.PublicDescription: Number Transactions requested of the CPU : Card writing to another Card (same or different stack) : Also known as Inbound.  Number of 64B cache line requests initiated by the Card, including reads and writes. : x8 card plugged in to Lane 2/3, Or x4 card is plugged in to slot 2

Events.PublicDescription: Number Transactions requested of the CPU : Card writing to another Card (same or different stack) : Also known as Inbound.  Number of 64B cache line requests initiated by the Card, including reads and writes. : x4 card is plugged in to slot 3

Events.BriefDescription: Number Transactions requested of the CPU : Card writing to another Card (same or different stack)
Events.PublicDescription: Number Transactions requested of the CPU : Card writing to another Card (same or different stack) : Also known as Inbound.  Number of 64B cache line requests initiated by the Card, including reads and writes. : x4 card is plugged in to slot 5

Events.BriefDescription: Number Transactions requested of the CPU : Card writing to another Card (same or different stack)

Events.BriefDescription: Number Transactions requested of the CPU : Card writing to another Card (same or different stack)
Events.PublicDescription: Number Transactions requested of the CPU : Card writing to another Card (same or different stack) : Also known as Inbound.  Number of 64B cache line requests initiated by the Card, including reads and writes. : x4 card is plugged in to slot 7
